MARTIN, Mrs. Clara—passed at
residence, 372 Mays street, N. W.,
February 14. Her funeral wiil be
announced by Ivey Brothers, mor-
ticians.

BRYANT, Miss Saiiie — Friends
and reiatives of Miss Saiiie Bryant
are invited to attend her funeral
today at 2 p. m. from Weicome
Friend Baptist church, Rev. H.
Lester officiating, assisted by Rev.
Steel. Interment, Chestnut Hiil
cemetery. Poiiard.

and Mrs. Truitt Byrd, Mr. and
Mrs. Chariie Kate Crowder and
famiiy, Mrs. Dora Shank, Mrs.

and Mrs. Mary Hardaway and
famiiy, Mr. and Mrs. Henry

of LaGrange, Ga.; Mr. and Mrs.
V. S. Green, Cincinnati, Ohio; Mr.
Wiiiie C. Hardaway, Minneapoiis,
Minn.: Mr. and Mrs. Rufus Green,
Winnsboro, 8S. C.; Mrs. L. W. San-
das, Newark, N. J.; Mrs. Mattie
Shank, Atianta; Miss Tommie Lee
Thrash, Atianta, are invited to at-
tend the funeral of Mr. Varner
Adams today (Thursday) at 2 p.
m. from Springfieid Baptist
church, Rev. W. C. Amos officiat-
ing. Interment, West View ceme-

al announcement later. Hauga-

1945. Funeral service wiil be an-
nounced later. Ike Lackey &
Son, Covington, Ga.

Earl Morris, 49,

Is Found Dead

Earl Morris, 49, of 163 Harris
street, N. W., Atianta barber, was
found dead eariy yesterday on
Techwood rive, between Harris
and Cain streets. A coroner’s jury

impaneied fast night by Mrs. Paul
Donehoo, Fuiton county coroner,
found he died from natural causes.

Surviving, in addition to Morris’
wife, are 21 son, Sgt. Raiph De-
Witt Morris, of the Army, on duty
in France;:four sisters, Mrs, Lu-
eiia Haiiman, Mrs. Ola Sudduth
and Mrs. Anna Timmons, ail of
Dougiasviiie, and Mrs. Alma Tim-
mons, of V\iaiia, and two brothers,
Homer Morris, of Birmingham,
Ala., and Kaymond Morris, of At-
lanta.

Funeral *ervices and burial wiil
be at 10 a..m. tomorrow at Doug-
lasviiie. Brandon-Bond-Condon
are in chazge.

FUNERAL NOTICES

Rites for Lt. Crowe
Wiil Be Heid Today

‘Funeral services for Lt. Morgan
R. Crowe, one of the seven Army
fiiers who lost their lives in a
bomber crash Monday, near Sa-
vannah, wiil be heid at 3:30 p. m.
today in the Hapeviiie First Bap-
tist church, with the Rev. Z.
Barron and the Rev. L. B. Jones
officiating. Burial wiil be in Col-
lege Park cemetery, under the di-
rection of Howard L. Carmichael.

Lt. Crowe, a 19-year-oid Hape-
viiie youth, was the son of Mr.
and Mrs. L. G. Burdette, of 513
Chestnut street. He joined the
Army Air Corps in June, 1943,
soon after he was graduated from
Hapeviiie High school.

Home Accident Survey

The accident prevention com-
mittee of the Atianta Red Cross
wiil meet at 4:30 p. m. today at
the Y, M. C. A. Plans for a city-
county survey of home accidents
wiil be discussed.
